articles.title: ITR Filing Guide for AY 2026-27: Forms, Slabs, Deductions & Penalties
articles.excerpt: A complete and practical guide to filing Income Tax Returns in India for AY 2026-27, covering salaried, freelancers, and small business taxpayers.

seo.meta_title: ITR Filing AY 2026-27: Step-by-Step Guide for India
seo.meta_description: Learn how to file ITR in India for AY 2026-27. Understand ITR forms, new tax regime slabs, Section 87A rebate, due dates, and penalties.

content.introduction: Income Tax Return filing is a statutory obligation in India and a critical financial record. For AY 2026-27, the New Tax Regime continues as the default system, making it essential for taxpayers to understand slabs, rebates, and compliance requirements.
content.why_it_matters_in_india: A correctly filed ITR is required for loan approvals, visa processing, carry-forward of losses, and avoiding penalties under the Income Tax Act, 1961.
content.who_should_read: Salaried employees, freelancers, professionals, and small business owners.

detailed_sections.heading: Who Must File an ITR in India
detailed_sections.content: Individuals whose total income exceeds the basic exemption limit, those claiming refunds, foreign asset holders, and certain high-value transaction cases must file an ITR as per income tax rules.

detailed_sections.heading: Which ITR Form Should You Use
detailed_sections.content: ITR-1 is for salaried individuals with simple income. ITR-3 applies to business owners. ITR-4 is used for presumptive taxation under Sections 44AD and 44ADA, subject to eligibility conditions.

detailed_sections.heading: New Tax Regime Explained
detailed_sections.content: Under the current provisions, income tax rebate under Section 87A may effectively reduce tax liability for eligible taxpayers, subject to conditions prescribed in the Finance Act applicable for AY 2026-27.

step_by_step_guides: Log in to the Income Tax e-filing portal using PAN.
Review AIS and Form 26AS for income and TDS details.
Submit and e-verify the return using Aadhaar OTP or net banking.
real_indian_examples: A salaried employee earning â‚¹12 lakh annually may have zero tax liability under Section 87A rebate, subject to eligibility and current law.
common_mistakes: Mismatch between AIS and declared income.
Failure to e-verify the return within prescribed time.

faqs.question: What is the due date for ITR filing?
faqs.answer: For most individual taxpayers, the due date is 31 July of the assessment year, unless extended by the Income Tax Department.

content.penalties_and_deadlines: Late filing fee under Section 234F may apply, subject to income limits and filing date.
tools_and_calculators_to_link: Old vs New Tax Regime Calculator
content.conclusion: Timely and accurate ITR filing ensures financial credibility and compliance. Always verify data and comply with current tax laws.

content.introduction: GST compliance in India is technology-driven and time-sensitive. Regular filing is mandatory to retain GSTIN validity and claim Input Tax Credit.
content.why_it_matters_in_india: Non-compliance can result in late fees, interest, and suspension of GST registration.
content.who_should_read: Traders, service providers, manufacturers, and MSME owners.

detailed_sections.heading: GST Registration Applicability
detailed_sections.content: GST registration is mandatory if turnover exceeds prescribed limits or in special cases such as inter-state supply.

detailed_sections.heading: Input Tax Credit Rules
detailed_sections.content: ITC can be claimed only when invoices reflect in GSTR-2B and conditions under Section 16 of the CGST Act are met.

step_by_step_guides: Prepare monthly sales and purchase data.
real_indian_examples: A small retailer improves cash flow by timely ITC reconciliation with suppliers.

faqs.question: What is the late fee for GST returns?
faqs.answer: Late fees are charged per day, subject to maximum limits as prescribed under GST law.

content.penalties_and_deadlines: Due dates vary by return type. Late fees and interest apply for delays.
content.conclusion: Consistent GST compliance protects business operations and cash flow.
